g.text: That main network is carved into 4 x
through static routing and Guest VLANs
(tagging within your nested environment, and encapsulated into the Geneve VNI of your assigned
It also provides you the flexibility to create your own VLANs & networks within your nested
environment as if you were in control of you virtual TORs. that said the routing of other subnets
avoid any duplicate/routes or other fancy
You are free to add a VyOS/network appliance to manage any subnets created on guest VLANs
(for example VLAN 109 with 192.168.1.0/24) and route them back/NAT as you wish and can
potentially advertise them via static routes through your zPod T1.
